MPOE significantly reduced serum ALT and AST, indicating a preserved liver integrity and improved function ( Table 3). MPOE treatment markedly increased the liver antioxidant capacity by restraining the LPO byproduct (MDA) and simultaneously enhancing the activities of SOD, catalase, and regeneration of GSH ( Table 4). Our data come in line with previous studies that reported the hepatoprotective effect of M. piperita [ 18] or its oil [ 19]. It was suggested that several active components of Mentha have antioxidant and antiperoxidant activities that provoke the capacity of endogenous antioxidant systems and protect against toxic hepatic damages [ 18, 19, 70].
